entities.name: pensieve
entities.description: A device used by Dumbledore to store and examine thoughts, described as a container that holds excess thoughts.

entities.name: basin
entities.description: A container where the excess thoughts are poured into, mentioned in the context of the Pensieve.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: The person who uses the Pensieve and explains its function to Harry.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: The person who is being shown the Pensieve by Dumbledore.

entities.name: wand
entities.description: A tool used by wizards to cast spells, mentioned in the context of Dumbledore's actions.

entities.name: hair
entities.description: Dumbledore's hair is mentioned as a location where he places his wand tip.

relationships.description: Dumbledore uses the Pensieve to store and examine thoughts, as described in the text.
The basin is mentioned as a container where excess thoughts are poured into, which Dumbledore uses with the Pensieve.
Harry observes the Pensieve and its contents, including the swirling white substance in the basin.
Dumbledore uses his wand to perform an action related to the Pensieve.
Dumbledore places the tip of his wand into his own silver hair, near his temple.
